SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.manager

Class GameLoopManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.manager.GameLoopManager
public class GameLoopManager extends Object
The GameLoopManager class is responsible for managing the game loop using the singleton pattern. It provides methods to start, stop, pause, and resume the game loop, as well as to set the game loop updater. The class also supports property change listeners to notify other components of changes in the game loop state.

Animation Timer:

The game loop is implemented using JavaFX's AnimationTimer, which calls the updater's update method on each frame.

See Also:

  • AnimationTimer

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static GameLoopManager getInstance()
      Retrieves the singleton instance of GameLoopManager. Implements double-checked locking for thread safety and performance.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of GameLoopManager.

    • addPropertyChangeListener

      public void addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
      Adds a PropertyChangeListener to the listener list. The listener is registered for all properties.
      Parameters:
      listener - the PropertyChangeListener to be added

    • removePropertyChangeListener

      public void removePropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
      Removes a PropertyChangeListener from the listener list. This method should be called to unregister a listener that was previously added.
      Parameters:
      listener - the PropertyChangeListener to be removed

    • setUpdater

      public void setUpdater(GameLoopHandler updater)
      Sets the GameLoopHandler updater and initializes the game loop.
      Parameters:
      updater - the GameLoopHandler to be set

    • startLoop

      public void startLoop()
      Starts the game loop if it has been initialized. If the game loop is not initialized, it logs a message indicating that.

    • stopLoop

      public void stopLoop()
      Stops the game loop if it is currently running. This method checks if the game loop is not null and then stops it. It also prints a message to the console indicating that the game loop has been stopped.

    • pauseGame

      public void pauseGame()
      Pauses the game if it is not already paused. This method sets the paused state to true and fires a property change event to notify listeners about the change in the paused state.

    • resumeGame

      public void resumeGame()
      Resumes the game if it is currently paused. This method changes the paused state to false and fires a property change event to notify listeners about the change in the paused state.

    • isPaused

      public boolean isPaused()
      Checks if the game loop is currently paused.
      Returns:
      true if the game loop is paused, false otherwise.
